title: Memoirs of the life of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Lockhart, J. G.
snippet: I was telling Willie Laidlaw that I might adopt, with a slight difference, the motto of the noble Tullibardine : — * Furth Fortune and Jile the Fetters.'"*

title: Domestic details
author: Crossrig, David Hume
snippet: In the dedication  to John Earl of Tullibardine, Lord Secretary of State for Scotland, Dallas mentions that he had charge of the Athol estates for many years.

title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes.
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: On the last day of Januarythe troops of Argyle crossed the Eame without opposition, and advanced to Tullibardine, within eight miles of Perth.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: On the last day of January thetroops of Argyle crossed the Earne without opposition, and advanced to Tullibardine, within eightmiles of Perth.

title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: On the last day of January, the troops of Argylecrossed the Earae without opposition, and advancedto Tullibardine, within eight miles of Perth.

title: Travels in Scotland: translated from the German. With notes by the translator [John Kesson]
author: Kohl, Johann Georg.
snippet: The oldest title of the family is " Baron Murray of Tullibardine," as generally in Scotland the baronial is shore ancient thanthe ducal title.* The other titles are as follows :—Earl ofTullihardine, Earl of Athol, Marquis of Athol, Viscount ofBalquhidder, Baron Murray, Balvenie, and Gask, Duke of Athol,Marquis of Tullihardine, Earl of Strathtay and Strathardle,Viscount of Glenalmond and Glenlyon.
